questions.title: Basic Ohm's Law Application
questions.question_text: A circuit has a 12V battery connected to a 4Ω resistor. What is the current flowing through the circuit?
questions.feedback_correct: Correct! Using Ohm's Law: I = V/R = 12V/4Ω = 3A
questions.feedback_incorrect: Remember Ohm's Law: I = V/R. Divide voltage by resistance.

questions.title: Power Calculation
questions.question_text: Calculate the power dissipated by a 6Ω resistor when 2A flows through it. Enter your answer in watts.
questions.feedback_incorrect: Use the power formula: P = I²R

questions.title: Series Circuit Voltage Division
questions.question_text: In a series circuit with two equal resistors, each resistor drops exactly half the total applied voltage.
questions.feedback_correct: True! Equal resistors in series divide voltage equally according to the voltage divider rule.
questions.feedback_incorrect: Consider the voltage divider principle: voltage divides proportionally to resistance values.
